content: RAANANA  Israel Israeli defense electronics company Elbit Systems forecasts double-digit growth for its Cyberbit business  which is transforming the technology it has long provided for military intelligence to the fast-growing commercial market.    Cyberbit took shape after Elbit's $150 million acquisition of the cyber and intelligence unit of Israel's Nice Systems in 2015  blending Nice's technology designed for law enforcement and intelligence agencies with Elbit's military-focused
name: Elbit Systems Ltd
